Join the VF Family We are one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish through our family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands. At the heart of our journey lies our company-wide purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. It’s a commitment shared by all of our global associates across brands. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling.We believe that when you discover the difference between a career and a calling, you get so much more out of life. When those lines begin to blur, you start to limit yourself much less and start aiming for more. That’s what we want for everyone who joins us at VF. And frankly, that’s what it takes to thrive here.Here you can do the best work of your life. We are purpose led and performance driven, people-focused and supportive. Most importantly, we believe that everyone should be empowered to be their authentic self and we power an internal movement of inclusion and belonging. Our teams are built on a global mindset, sparked by sharp minds of diverse individuals and reflects the global consumers we serve.Bring your energy and fresh perspective, contribute to our movement and build your future with us. Vice President, Global AnalyticsVF Corporation is seeking a seasoned leader to oversee the global analytics organization. Reporting to the VP, Global Data and Advanced Analytics, the VP, Global Analytics will drive the vision, strategy, and creation of a best-in-class analytics organization delivering actionable insights to brands and operational teams around the global. They will have the opportunity to build upon a strong foundation of data science and technology foundations to shape analytics products and services that drive transformational impact covering marketing effectiveness, commercial operations, product and pricing optimization, and deep consumer insights for some of the world’s most recognizable brands. This is a highly visible role for an educator who can lead the conversation in use of information to improve decision making.How You Will Make a Difference What you will do: Define the vision, strategy, and multi-year plans to deliver on major objectives in conjunction with executive leadership and the overall corporate strategy.Elevate the depth and breadth of analytics and insights services. Work to constantly evolve existing services establishing a deep understanding of business needs with key partners and moving with agility at the speed of the consumer.Become a trusted advisor and the voice of objective expertise helping to orient VF brands and functions on the path of their digital transformation journey. Speak the language of retail consumer brands and operational teams.Communicate impactfully and appropriately at all levels of the organization. Leverage your diverse technical and business acumen to connect fluidly across different teams and functions with ability to resolve conflicts that are complex.Carry a consumer first mindset and lead the organization to master the fundamentals with precision and agility.Partner with data science leaders to expand the impact and use of predictive models by fusing machine learning capabilities into analytics products that expand the scope of impact.Evaluate internal and external services and software and make financial decisions that stand up new, value-add capabilities and eliminate redundant or low impact services. Collaborate with data engineering leaders to prioritize acquisition and modeling of new datasets that deliver incremental values to enterprise teams, leveraging our enterprise data foundations platform.Institutionalize agile delivery practices that move at the pace of the company and the consumer. Create structures that help data and business intelligences teams organize into cross functional delivery squads while balancing the need to react quickly to operational needs. Hire, develop and retain top engineering, analytics, and data science talent. Mentors and grows the team while maintaining a high technical bar and securing talent that embodies our culture.Lead with diplomacy – engage and facilitate agreements with conflicting parties on matters of significance to the enterprise, while maintaining a sharp focus on business success with our consumers and shareholders.Influence and lead cross functional teams across the globe in DT and other functions such as Marketing and Operations to help implement better tools and resources and set strategy aligned with business goals.Design and deliver tiered services offerings for a variety of brands that have a diverse set of budgets, current capabilities, and business priorities.Exhibit strong fiduciary duties by gaining the most leverage from current resources and incremental funding asks. Develop and adhere to annual budgets and be accountable for results.Demonstrated expert level communication and presentation skills. Must be able to fluidly communicate across a highly matrixed organization with many different levels of knowledge of data and its use.Free To Be, Inclusion & Diversity As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.Skills for SuccessYears of Related Professional Experience: 15+ years progressive leadership positions in data and analytics functions with at least 5+ years managing teams.Educational Position Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Operational Research, Analytics, Data Science, Marketing, or related field. Master’s degree and/or MBA preferred.Experience leading large data and analytics organizations in global direct to consumer brands.Experience dealing with challenging priorities in a fast-paced environment.Demonstrated experience engaging and influencing senior executives and managing stakeholders.Extensive experience in creating concrete action plans with measurable business impact in a highly ambiguous and matrixed corporate environment.Demonstrated ability to manage large budgets with strong financial acumen.Applied experience balancing operations and feature delivery across engineering squads.Experience resolving conflicts that are complex and involve divergent audience perspectives; interaction requires tact and diplomacy; able to facilitate agreement between conflicting parties.Extensive theoretical and practical knowledge of statistical modeling, retail operations, marketing and consumer insights, and consumer durables business acumen and ability to apply that knowledge to build and lead a function.Background in applied statistics and/or machine learning a bonus.Executive presence and ability to persuade senior leaders.Strong emotional intelligence, resilience, and empathy.Ability to resolve complex problems, find innovative solutions, and provide practical recommendations.Exceptional communication and presentation skills.VF Guiding Principles: Live with Integrity, Act Courageously, Be Curious, Act with Empathy, and Persevere.What’s in it For YouWe’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage both mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package. Go to MyVFBenefits.com and click on “Looking to Join VF” to learn more.We just have one question. Are you in?
